content: **link given inside the pdf to the full video tutorial on youtube ** this pattern can be made in many yarn weights & fibres use suitable hook for the yarn you choose start with the recommended hook size on your yarn ball band and experiment **other supplies ** yarn scissors tapestry needle stitch markers x 2 poppies are a symbol of remembrance and as such are suitable for anzac day memorial day or remembrance day they may be made in red purple black or white for these occasions however red poppies are the most common red - flanders poppy symbolises remembrance for the fallen white - commitment to peace and remembrance of casualties purple - commemorate the animal victims of war horses dogs and pigeons black - a symbol of grief you could also choose to create these in any colour you like wear a poppy as a brooch or create decorations for the home for any time of year using very little yarn they re a fabulous way to use up your yarn scraps experiment with various yarns and appropriate hook sizes for different sized poppies some suggestions are given in the pdf remember we d love to see your creativity here on ravelry as a project please share on instagram or in our crochet road community facebook group
